key_channel_insights.line_content: 73.43% of OTA prices were higher than the airline's website, indicating limited competitive pricing.
85.5% of MSE offers were lower than the airline's website, reflecting a strong pricing strategy.
71.28% of GDS listings were priced higher than the airline's website, revealing a persistent trend.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 73.43% of OTA offerings were priced higher than the airline's website across all routes.
Only 0.9% of offers were found cheaper on the OTA channel, indicating minimal competitive pricing.
Despite minor fluctuations, the overall pricing discrepancy remains consistent over the last month.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: A significant majority (73.43%) of the OTA listings reflect higher prices compared to the airline's site across all dimensions.
Only 13.29% of OTA offerings match the airline prices, which suggests limited competitive pricing at parity.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul routes, 75.63% of the OTA prices were higher than the airline website, confirming a consistent trend of elevated pricing.
Long-haul routes also reflect a high percentage (57.23%) of OTA listings priced above the airline's own prices, though slightly less than short-hauls.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In routes originating from Norway, 73.75% of OTA prices were higher than the airline website, revealing potential price sensitivity.
With 72.51% higher prices in non-Norway origin routes, competitive pricing is consistently lacking.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, 72.49% of OTA offerings were priced higher than on the airline website, representing stable pricing trends.
In far-out bookings, 75.35% of prices tracked on OTAs exceeded the airline's listed prices, indicating a persistent price premium.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 85.5% of all observations showed lower prices on the MSE channel compared to the airlineâ€™s website.
Prices on the MSE channel have remained lower by an average of 0.09% compared to last week, reflecting a stable trend.
There has been an increase of 8.35% in the frequency of lower prices on the MSE channel compared to the previous month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The MSE channel recorded a 9.14% offer frequency with no comparable price on the airline's website in the latest week.
The frequency of offers deemed 'same' dropped to 5.40% in the latest week, down from 6.71% the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul flights, MSE offered lower prices 85.77% of the time, with an average price difference decrease of 0.10%.
Long haul flights showed a lower price frequency of 83.24% on the MSE channel, with a significant decrease in price difference of 0.06% in the latest week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating from Norway, MSE prices were lower in 92.11% of cases compared to the airline's website, with offers remaining consistent.
MSE demonstrated lower pricing at 66.93% for non-Norwegian points of origin, indicating a competitive pricing strategy.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In close-in bookings, the MSE channel offered lower prices 85.82% of the time, with an average price decrease of 0.08%.
For far-out bookings, 84.94% of flights were found at lower prices on the MSE channel, with the average price down by 0.12%.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel exhibited a higher price in 71.28% of the analyzed origin-destination pairs for the latest week.
Only 0.90% of prices were lower in the GDS than on the airline's website, indicating minimal price benefit for travelers.
About 13.22% of offers maintained the same price in both the GDS and the airline's website, showing consistency in certain price points.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_title: Increasing Price Discrepancy from Last Week
gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The frequency of GDS prices being higher compared to the airline's website increased by 0.62% from the previous week.
The same pricing status maintained a steady rate of 13.22% in the latest week, consistent with previous weeks.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul routes, 74.29% of prices in the GDS were higher than on the website, underscoring a substantial pricing discrepancy.
In long-haul services, 49.13% of GDS prices were higher, with prices showing an increasing trend.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In flights originating from Norway, 73.66% were priced higher in the GDS compared to the airline's website.
For routes outside Norway, the GDS showed higher prices in 64.75% of cases, indicating a less pronounced gap.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, the GDS listed higher prices 70.05% of the time, suggesting increased costs for last-minute travelers.
In far-out bookings, 73.75% of prices in the GDS were higher, with a notable uptick in price matches since last month.
